intro: Tephrosia tricolor, commonly known as the three-color tephrosia, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa and Asia. It is a shrub or small tree that typically grows to a height of 1–3 meters. The plant produces small, clustered flowers in shades of white, pink, and purple, which bloom throughout the year in some regions. Its leaves are trifoliate, meaning they consist of three leaflets, and the plant has a woody stem with a rough texture. Tephrosia tricolor is often found in disturbed soils and can thrive in a variety of environmental conditions.
